title: Error hadnling rework. Remove and prune vulnerable `failure` crate as dependency.
body:
**Remove and prune vulnerable `failure` crate as dependency. Rework error handling. Make error handling messages substituted by derived macro on `Error` enum, with macro provided by `thiserror` crate. Update and bump up project dependencies.**

Hey guys!

`Failure` crate is vulnerable in terms of `Fail` type non-local implementation and marco expansion.

https://github.com/andrcmdr/secure-enclaves-framework/security/dependabot/37

https://github.com/andrcmdr/secure-enclaves-framework/security/dependabot/36

I've recently made a fix for that vulnerability by completely removing `failure` crate and replacing it with `thiserror`. Problem caused by non-local impl of `Fail` type and `Fail` macro expansion in already unsupported `failure` crate. Strange error handling solution overall. Better not to introduce such dependencies and use standalone error handling approach from Rust stdlib.
Also changed an `Error` type in dummy.rs implementation to that errors and its messages from `openssl` submodule, that's more correct.
Also updated some outdated dependencies (as OpenSSL, which also was vulnerable several times recently).

Thus opened up this PR as interested in this library further development, other additional cipher suites implementation and library support overall.

Feel free to take it and pull from here:

https://github.com/andrcmdr/vrf-rs/commit/3304a65e5abae98618db70c729d21d36f4dbc7fd

https://github.com/andrcmdr/vrf-rs

Wonderful library, following RFCs, appreciate your work! Keep it up!
